mn_FFAgmFDcLdldmbhVplw.text: Can't believe they've only been open a couple days! The meal was fantastic from start to finish. Tried the anticuchos, carapulcra, and alfajores for dessert. Everything tasted fresh, well seasoned, and home made. Great portions too! Will be back for more soon!

q5T3nndnuLm8go5h7hLFWg.text: Very hard to find a good Peruvian restaurant that stays in business over a year. NJNAlZh8IN1JkC-RbkoKQw.text: This restaurant is a "must" for any lover of Latin A,Erica's cuisine.  I had the Frijoles con Seco a la Nortena (stewed beef with rice and beans) all I can say is "wow"! Service was quick and pleasant, definitely a return visit on the agenda, although I'll make sure to share so that we can try the deserts too!

SPE1tvLWeQlbeY-0U1Ivew.text: We found this place on Yelp and it's definitely worth the try. The staff is extremely nice, the food is amazing and their especial desert is phenomenal. FaglQzcJTxhKGPmxYTGieg.text: The food here is actually better than a lot of the food that I had in Peru (not sure what this means). Our favorite is the arroz con pollo with cilantro rice, aji potatoes, and pickled onions. The chicken is so flavorful, moist. The rice has pieces of the giant corn in it.  We've also tried the ceviche, escabeche de pollo, carapulcra. All great.  Love how they serve cancha, the Peruvian corn nuts, as a pre-meal snack!

8BF3Yj1d5piXN1nYBfZwgA.text: I always love eating here.   I've never ordered something that didn't taste amazing. Today it was the tacu tacu- so good! I've had the vegetarian and beef versions and they were equally tasty.  Today I decided to order a juice withi lunch and tried the lucuma with milk.  I highly, highly recommend this drink.  It is a native Peruvian fruit that tastes so familiar, but you just can't place it.  And the milk just takes it over the top (in a good way!)  If you haven't eaten here yet, you're missing out.

QheeGjFm7QWnxAjY9bAebA.text: I've had my fair share of Peruvian food here in the valley. I'm surprised that there actually are so many to choose from. I would give it 5 stars if ratings were based only on the food! Not only does it taste great, it even is presented beautifully.  Now, what brings this place down is the location. My biggest gripe is the A/C seems to not always be running cool. Not to mention it isn't the nicest looking of restaurants. For the price I expect a bit more class. bYoO2vPZHjAaVGsh4pQ_yA.text: I love Peruvian food!  This place is a hidden gem on 7th street.  Prices are fair so don't be shocked if you are looking for something cheap.  This is not "a five dollar footlong."  The place is a family operation and the environment is great.  They show south american soccer which is a plus especially during world cup qualifiers. Any soccer fans out there???   Nothing beats a good Pisco Sour or Ceviche.     Karen is one of my favorite servers. She is direct and to the point and very Knowledgeable.   Her brother in the kitchen is also very funny and friendly.   I would definitely recommend making a visit.  If your wondering what "El Chullo" means it is like a andean beanie which covers your ears and if you have ever been in Peru, Ecuador or Northern Chile you would definitely understand why its needed.

YZybW0IHalBZcsyLGD5B_w.text: Ceviche and Anticuchos are outstanding! The Maracuya sour or Passionfruit pisco is so delicious and refreshing. Excellent service. Highly recommend El Chullo

rkHondEbrH1UmV4upp1XGw.text: Ell Chullo is a hidden little gem in central Phoenix with fabulous Peruvian food and drinks that shouldn't be missed by anyone who loves south american food. It is a family run restaurant that takes their cooking seriously with great service and a fun atmosphere. Don't miss the Pisco Sours, Lomo Saltado or awesome ceviche. Save room for dessert because they have some amazing homemade creations and don't forget to order the outstanding hot chocolate made with special chocolate from Peru. My only complaint is that their parking is not ideal.

B_6oBXk8femFzzn-QeX5WA.text: We ended up in this restaurant with a search in yelp. This is a great place overall: customer service, cleanliness, nice environment. The food is fresh and the portions are huge! My mom and I will be sharing next time; had a lot of left overs. I really want to go back to have some pisco sour :) Parking is hard as the store is facing 7th st and there are only 5 to 6 spots in the front; so park in the back and come in.  Main cross roads are 7th st and McDowell. Head north on 7th street and it will be in the corner of Virginia - NE corner.

ezxDEItgkGiucovmNFMsZw.text: My first time and I'm gonna bring everyone i know to this place! I've never had Peruvian cuisine before, so I can't judge the authenticity. uWk9tToMX3yz9L5nKGmw2w.text: El Chullo Peruvian is a small inviting place. It hosts a very special menu of a variety of Peruvian plates. First you get to taste a sample of toasted corn. I ordered two dishes, both seafood and walked out very satisfied. Jalea Mixta Ceviche Mixto

YRmvuikFqAE6rHKf74rnUQ.text: In this quaint restaurant, which is challenging to find parking, the atmosphete is not quite South American.  The wait staff was appreciative of my Castellano and as a Limeno, know the ropes.  The papa relleno was great and prepared with a crisp exterior.  The lomo saltado was extremly tender, but startingly more trendy than authentic.  It lacked the bold asian flvors that are part of Peru's subculture and would make Fujimori proud.  The Aji de gallina tasted as if it was from a paste rather than real aji amarillos.  While some dishes are good, It is better to excel at least with the popular national dishes.  I will have to try agsain.

WIx475vpgTIHnC55iM2OwQ.text: This is a great restaurant! The food is always delicious. If you're tired of the same ol Mexican dishes and want to try something different than that, or want to maybe impress a lady with your advanced knowledge of world cuisine, this is a welcomed change of pace.  Our regular dishes are  *Ceviche mixto - hot*  The most delicious "white" ceviche, bathed in a scorching pinkish sauce. If I have it right, it has strips of fish, lil octopi, calamari, tiny scallops, tiny clams, and mussels. The heat of the hot isn't for wimps, but is addicting like flaming hot Cheetos. I.E. you can't stop or the burning really starts.  *Jalea Mixta* Basically a fried version of the above, minus the fiery sauce. The breading is crisp and delicious. Not spicy like the ceviche though. *Lomo Saltado* I would describe this as gourmet carne asada fries or as Peruvian poutine. Tender and flavorful steak strips over a bed of fries smothered in a light and savory gravy sauce. This being accompanied by the most perfectly cooked and tasty onions (I generally loathe onions) and a few tomatoes.  Everyone I have brought here has, at a minimum, enjoyed this restaurant. Most have loved it. This includes my boss, who can be, we'll say - "picky" about new foods from different cultures and food in general. We are located in Deer Valley and he has actually brought this place up as a place to go since being introduced. That's saying a lot.  There are a couple of downsides to El Chullo, but not enough for me to remove any stars.  *Parking* The front is a tiny lil strip of parking for maybe 5 cars max that you have to basically pull off of the road and slide into the parking spot. You could try to pull in and be left sticking out into busy 7th street traffic. The back is accessible through a narrow alley and is a very tight maybe 8 car lot. I've parked back there and had to do an ass clinched 40 point turn to get out when it filled up after. Maybe take an Uber if you don't want to bother with that.  *seating* This place is small, don't bring a big party! They don't have a lot of room in the dining area for that. It fills up quick and if you are an ornery sumbich your lil tushy might get hurt waiting for the delicious food. *pisco sour price* Damn this is an awesome drink. But at $14 bucks a pop, can't down 3-4 of these like I would like to. The homie that was a Scottsdale bartender for years loves these so that should tell you how good they are. I'm sure the price is well worth it, but it just stings to see the bill if you've enjoyed a few.  So yes, there's a whole bunch of info for you. If you're on the fence, swan dive off, and make the trip because this place rules!

qorpem_fS2rfOgFyH4H5JA.text: decided to go back after a horrible experience about a month ago, everyone has days off but the fact is that this place is the absolut definition of over rating, just can not understand the massive good reviews, am sure they are legit, and maybe i just happen to be there on two off days for food and specially service.

hudI4AQwWnmtXCUlVZgEjA.text: This is my favorite place in town. I love the food, the service is phenomenal, they are so quick! The food is super authentic to Peru. I especially love their fish ceviche !! Watch out, it's a little on the spicy side,I would not get this dish if you don't like spice!

XBs6nrZPxMqiNr_X_5M-0A.text: El Chullo does not have much of a parking lot. On Thursday 1 PM, I went with a group of ten. There was no room in their parking lot. The restaurant seats maybe 20-25. They do not have lunch specials and it will cost you close to $20 for lunch.  Peruvian food in general is not hot. Id asked about this and they were very willing to accommodate me with a bottle of hot sauce. I refused. If that is not how it's supposed to be.  The food is mild and flavorful. There is a spaghetti dish made with beef. I have had it elsewhere made with fish. The real value meal was the seafood platter, with many and plenty of kinds of fish. Most dishes have a pyramid of rice. Others are over French Fries.  Service is as fast as the kitchen. The wait staff is very friendly and informative. The menu is explanatory to a degree. It needs supplementation. The server knew the menu well. El Chullo had no empty seats. They don't need to offer lunch specials.   The oldest reviews date back to 2014, so they have not just started up. Despite the cramped quarters and lack of parking, they have stayed in business. Maybe someday they will get more space inside and outside.   There are many items on the menu to try, but the lack of lower prices at lunchtime will keep me away.

Wi2l-YNpuKB7ivUle4r0ig.text: Great food, amazing service .....a must go to in Phoenix  The Tacu-Tacu with papas is phenomenal with a nice cold drink.

kIiZJfP_UvHoLM0emUISfA.text: You can never go wrong with El Chullo best Peruvian food in the valley! Definitely going to try out the whole menu

-32KEV7AmTJCYHXaTsXgZA.text: This restaurant is small but busy with a friendly crowd for lunch today--all watching & cheering the World Cup (Spain vs Portugal). Don't miss out on the back parking lot off an alleyway if the front lot is full! I ordered a dish with beans, rice, red onions and beef. If was quite tasty and service was attentive. We also got a side of plantains for the table--delicious. I am not sure I ordered their best dish, so want to return again and try something else. I will say it is a welcoming Peruvian restaurant that draws its own--but friendly and a fun place to go with an authentic menu!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DTJ-Ri-nZqAxUxW_5_ObJQ.text: I ate here on April 1, 2017 with 15 other people in an ethnic dining MeetUp.  I also ate here last fall, the day after having a bad dinner at Villa Peru. Villa Peru wanted to charge me for the very bland Chupe de Camarones Soup, that I wanted to send back to trade for something else, even though I only ate a few spoonfuls of the broth.  I never had any restaurant force me to pay for what I did not like and wanted to send back and trade for something else, in my life, and I am 20 years older than I look!  I went to Villa Peru 2 years ago, and also did not like my food, neither did other people at my table, to the point that they still had to pay for their wasted dish, AND pay for a side of "safe french fries" just because they were so hungry.   But I was open to giving Villa Peru another chance.   I Yelped Villa Peru 1 star because of bland, expensive, skimpy food, and scathing service.    The first time I ate at El Chullo, was the day after the Villa Peru fiasco, I ate the cerviche.  But the fish in both the Villa Peru and El Chullo, was very bland, boring, and flavorless.  It tasted like they just added the lime juice marinate to the fish the moment before bringing the fish to my table.  So I took it home, and four days later, the lime permeated the fish, and it tasted delicious!    But I did not Yelp El Chullo based on the one-time bland and boring fish in their cerviche, only.  I wanted to give El Chullo another chance, which i did when I ate with these 15 other people on April 1.  I tasted so many dishes, including cerviche second chance.  Very bland and boring, I mean the flavor of the fish.  I like my own homemade cerviche the best.  The steak was flavorful and good portion, but very gristley and full of oingy boingies not polite to spit out.

GHalUBbY_mKd-xOZ9lE2Ng.text: Nice little place. My daughter had the pollo saltado and she said it was delicious. My experience wasn't that great. I had ceviche pescado and it was a bit overpriced. I also started to feel a little woozy after a while. That part was mostly my fault because I am intolerant to dairy and forgot to ask them to not put it in my dish.

gvFU-IqfCZxMxZ761myNBQ.text: Food & Drinks are awesome. Tiny place and very comfortable and pleasant atmosphere for dinner.

8FaDQmfhXpLxFn1D0qkKYw.text: My first time at this restaurant and I loved it! Of course I went with a native from El Salvador so she could give me some direction. We only had coffee and dessert because we had already ate some place else but I took some food home (which my husband loved). We had their ice cream Lucuma and an alfajor, a little pricey coming at $6.00 each but they were amazing! The place was really clean and the staff very courteous. Definitely going back :)

KhbSf0sQT3f-38A0S8M3Jw.text: Oh sweet mystery of life at last I found you...  What an amazing experience we had. My friend had been ranting since we arrived in Phoenix the day before that he had tried Peruvian food in this previous trip to the U.S., and wanted to try more. When we got out of the Heard Museum I took a wrong turn heading back to our hotel, when we came across this place, and thought "why not? - seems to be sent by the gods at just the right time."  So the place doesn't look like much (although they said they are moving to a larger spot), but the food is incredible, and the staff is great. You can tell they really love what they do, and their passion shows now only in the cooking (You absolutely have to try the Cilantro Rice & Chicken) but also in the service. This is what every restaurant should aspire to be!

Mse1gbYm4-wW_rt7EaGYeA.text: Small restaurant that packs some big flavor. I had the ceviche and made it spicy. The dish was excellent, very tasty. Don't order spicy unless you can handle It. It was very good and big enough to make an entire meal. I love this place very friendly staff. 100% recommend!

X0D8_QxmDGyjbe1eP_aLdQ.text: It's been at least 2 years since we've been here and I must say it was even better then I remembered food was excellent in flavor and presentation. Service efficient and friendly and the place was packed. Drinks cold and frothy. I will definitely come back sooner rather than waiting another year. A definite must visit.

WVGU8QpD7ezEC6mbTMM1qw.text: I love this place!! I've been going to Chullo's for about 6 years. The food is delicious and the people that works there are amazing. It is a family owned restaurant and the whole family works there.  My husband and I got married and we wanted to get some peruvian food for the reception. One of the cooks was incredible kind to prepare the food on a very complicated day(holiday season)  We'll forever be thankful!

lXD4l-2iiFjvVEskfIji7g.text: El Chullo. When I saw on Yelp that this place was awesome, and I was in town, I definitely had to check it out. I've had Peruvian before, and this was a little something different. I know that there were a lot of Chinese influence on Peruvian food, sot his was exciting to check out what Phoenix had. Let's just say, I never had Peruvian like this. We ordered some different type of food so it was nice to the different options.  For the appetizers, we ordered the appetizer platter which we got the chance to try out three different types of apps. We ordered the Beef heart the Stuffed potato, and the frite. The beef heart and the stuffed potatoes were amazing. I would definitely recommend those if you're choosing between the two. The beef heart isn't as bad as you think it would be, the meat was quite tender and had a good amount of flavor. The frites were alright, there was actually nothing special to it.   For the Entree, I ordered the Frijol con seco a la nortena. It was pretty good, and it really was sort of leaning on just a beef stew. It came with beans, but the stew was well balanced and had a good amount of flavor. My first choice for entree they ran out and so I had to settle on this as it was something that caught my eye. Anyways, it's pretty normal, but it hits the spot.  Now, as far as the interior decor, that's something new. It's a little hole in the wall spot. It's something that you won't be used to, but then again a lot of places that I had experience in Phoenix was pretty much hole in the wall. This place is definitely legit though, with the nice soap operas on tv and and everything so simplistic.  Definitely, this place is somewhere you need to check out if you're wanting to try something out that's not Mexican and something new.

uk3L7urKPjElbSD5lvCg5Q.text: Delicious food great staff!! But.   .  Too expensive. Too small portions. And parking ...is horrible!

_3hHegjq4Ogy-Ub7D8V9jg.text: This place is amazing! I came here one evening when I was in Phoenix for work, very authentic vibe with a super friendly staff. I ordered the cause rellena & the chupa de camarones (seafood soup). I highly recommend!

4zXFwGtYyOHhupmVgdFJGg.text: First time trying a Peruvian Meal!  Loved it and the waitress was great , Thank you Adriana.  Gonna bring my family here to try some delicious seafood dishes and I'm especially looking forward for dessert next time!

NyxBSMBPIlPOIIZKyBVkLA.text: My trip to AZ isn't complete until I come here.  I HAVE to go every time I visit.  This is the best Peruvian food I have ever had.  Whatever you order will be amazing, I have had damn near everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing food at an amazing place!

nwdxdr-wblGhDWTUZAvfhA.text: Don't let the location or the appearance of the outside of the restaurant deter you from experiencing truly great Peruvian food. The appetizer sampler is a great start. My wife and I especially enjoyed the seafood and of course the potato dishes. The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. If you have never tried Peruvian food then this would be a great place to have your first experience.

NUPTFVkHiXfpH38v2fKSlA.text: This was my first time here with my wife. Her words exactly "What an experience!" We thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We ordered the ceviche with medium heat and the Escobeche con pollo, dark meat. Amazing! So many people have been talking about this place lately. I'm so glad we tried it. We will return!

a0KNoZy2_Xb_Tc_UyuGbLw.text: Excellent service,jalea, tacutacu con lomo, chicha, and maracuya  Aji de gallina was good (maybe too much yellow paste)  Highly recommend.  Im peruvian :)

IHZKrFIos9u0QCcWjITBIA.text: Super good hole in the wall place right next to the best beer selection in town at Virginia market. Awesome hidden gem of Phoenix.

rvBJFuiTfvQZsEIubwVEdQ.text: Being from Piura Peru I expect peruvian food to be like home ,I have to tell you this place is authentic very clean and friendly staff not like typical peruvian restaurant in Peru . I certainly recommend this peruvian restaurant. VIVA EL PERU CARAJO

HcpfJZ6Clb9Ji1BCQXSYlA.text: First time! Really enjoyed our dinner here. Good, authentic Peruvian food. Good service. Only issue is that it tends to be a bit loud. I will be coming back!

xHFgB9xnEG4ZDTg8WED3hQ.text: Went a few days ago. Service could've had been better for a place that wasn't so packed.  We had the papa la huancallina (always been a favorite), arroz chaufa y tallarin verde w/steak. Steak was a little on the salty side. To drink we had chicha morada which was bomb! Food was pretty good however, did not like the fact that they brought one of our plates 20 mins apart. Reason why I gave them 4 stars. I'd probably go again.

pVyY6tPJbcMgPcAjN-PD3g.text: First tip-Parking lot in the back through an alley. Easier than the front.  My friend and I came here to check it out and overall, we loved it. We came on a Saturday for lunch and it wasn't crowded so we got one on one personal treatment with the chef so we learned a lot.  Not to sound like a broken record but the ceviche is soooo good. I love the flavors. The ceviche is just the fish marinated and the ceviche mixto is fish, squid, mussels, and clams.  I think the ceviche of just fish is the better of the two. It just holds the flavor better.  And when they ask you how spicy, they actually mean it. The medium is pretty decently spicy.  So impressive since it's hard to actually get something to be spicy here in Phoenix.  I can only imagine how spicy hot is.  Been here three times and I still crave it.  Ok, on to other things I've tried several things and so far only one thing wasn't all that great but everything else has been. The causa rellena with imitation crab would be the one thing i say to avoid. My friend and I didnt think it was all that great esp. The arroz con pollo was yummy. The carapulcra is a pork stew and is like a comfort food.  If you like spicy, make sure to ask for the aji rocoto - Peruvian hot sauce/salsa. So yummy. It adds a good spice to the mild dishes.  Good lomo saltado according to bf. I do like that the fries are crispy and skinny.  The kicker is that if you go now, they finally have air conditioning!!!  It was getting to be a bit difficult going during the summer so I can only imagine how the workers felt.  Warning though, if you are from California and used to Peruvian food there, they don't carry the green aji sauce that we know and love.  Apparently that's only a CA creation since we're so used to jalapenos. This is a must place. From the wait staff to the food, everything is too notch.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carapulcra - sun dried pork stew with fried yuca. Pretty good.
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz con pollo
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Causa rellena - potato cake with crab filling

GxaEf71Bzjg2UkHsRoEJXw.text: I've driven by this hidden Peruvian Cafe many times and never noticed it until tonight. Truly a hole-in-the-wall from the outside but a nice cozy restaurant in the inside. The wait staff were friendly and efficient. I had the Yuca Fritas appetizer and Mariscos con Arroz entree. I enjoy the Yuca and the two sauces. Some of the Yuca pieces were hard and stringy, but the rest was quite nice. The Mariscos were a disappointment. A few pieces of the seafood were very hard and chewy like they were seriously overlooked. These pieces were inedible. Most of the rest of the dish was good, but not great. I was expecting more flavor that would make this uniquely Peruvian. I will come back again and order a completely different entree. I want to like this place and I think it's definitely worth another shot.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yuca Fritas were my favorite part!
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mariscos con Arroz

ASsYclYJTQoGhAd6ndaOgA.text: I had never had Peruvian food and was excited to try this place. At 11:45 on Tuesday, it was not too crowded. The service was quick and friendly. My friend had the Arroz Con Pollo (Cilantro based green rice with veggies, & pan fried chicken) I had the Arroz Chaufa (Peruvian/Chinese Fusion Style chicken fried rice). Both dishes were great. Mine looked a bit like a standard fried rice but had a much bigger punch of flavor. The highlight of his dish was definitely that cilantro rice. SO GOOD. He ordered white meat and his bone-in breast was a bit dry. I am a dark meat gal, so would order that instead if I get it myself. I have to go back for the ceviche though. I saw a couple plates go by and wish I was not on a 1 hour work break. Those mountains of seafood need time to be savored. Man it looked good! Definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz Con Pollo (Cilantro based green rice with veggies, &amp; pan fried chicken)
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz Chaufa (Peruvian/Chinese Fusion Style chicken fried rice)

1th4jDy2QWVUgbQmThCJLw.text: Delicious food and great service!! Our waiter recommended some dishes for us since it was our first time and they were perfect!!

bGuN6pbDY0q6iCSbbh95Ig.text: Pros:  Food, service, price.  Cons: Smaller sized restaurant (may be occasional waits), parking (park across the street - see parking section below).  The food here is amazing.  I had the Tacu Tacu Con Lomo Saltado, which is rice and beans topped with strips of marinated sirloin steak.  The rice must be cooked in a small cast iron skillet and flipped over, because it has a seriously delicious exterior with a slight crunch.  The beans and lomo saltado are equally excellent.  Portion sizes are large, and they have a small selection of wine.  Really delicious and highly recommend.    Parking: After business hours (ie: 6:00pm) you can park either across 7th street at the auto shop, or across Virginia street, just south of El Chullo, in the parking lot behind the 3 story building (Techniprint).

bq3OHjq04sXmVsWuTgYtBQ.text: Went with a meetup group to this place.  It's so small, only a local would notice it.  I'm really glad I went.  While it seems to take forever to get meals, it seems because they really put a lot of care into the cooking and presentation of the meal.  For a little place, they don't just throw the food on a plate, but present it with rice molded in pyramids or hemispheres; appetizers can be multilayered in cylinders...all colorful and super flavorful.  But a number of the dishes do rely heavily on rice.  The one I had, which was basically rice with brown sauce and mushrooms and beans with a few other veggies, had the unique taste that the rice seemed crispy on top, like it had been run through the broiler.  I think it is these touches that may help take time to get the food.  But the waitstaff is friendly and was more than willing to make suggestions to those at our table that knew nothing of the cuisine.    Try the non-alc Peruvian drink...it is delicious, with a nice taste of cloves.  I like the unique flavors and generous portions and very reasonable prices.  Just don't expect to be in and out.  Good place to come with others to pass the time and chat.  I'm putting down "NOT good for kids"...because I don't think they'd have the patience.

pn_YmySixbzCPgAT01rpJA.text: Literally, everything is delicious. Brought my Peruvian dad who often is not impressed, he likes it better than our regular spots back home.  Appetizer combo, Lomo Saltado this time. Even the cocktails are delicious.

ns_ts3Z4TH4cOrIpiLybJg.text: Incredible tallarin con mariscos (spaghetti with seafood). I had not seen this preparation before and as a Peruvian and a foodie I have an abundant amount of experience in Peruvian cuisine! The flavor was incredible, bursting with flavor! A bit of Rocoto to add a nice touch of spiciness. I had to order a side a rice so I could absorb all of the fabulous juice. My wife had a sampler platter with Papa a la Huancaina, papa rellena and causa! She raved about each of them. She also had an Afajor for dessert and it was wonderful! The owners are a family, each contributing to the success of the restaurant! Pricing is competitive. We went this evening  and had to wait about 15 minutes as we apparently are not the only ones who know about this wonderful little restaurant! The restaurant is small but as they continue to build a clientele, this place is certain to grow and be even more successful!

hMsLcgoveXCDxegvhDAdAA.text: Finally, a True to flavor Peruvian restaurant.  I've been to several in the Valley but non compare. This is the spot to enjoy a variety of delicous Pisco Sour concoctions along with all the favorite traditional dishes such as Lomo Saltado or Tacu Tacu. They also have several other options that are unknown Peruvian inspired.  Check this place out,  it rocks!

Z4YTrDn62b98DogGCUEpIg.text: Really disappointed, I ordered the lomo saltado in beef and a casa rellena for takeout. When I got there the food was already bagged up and when paying I got charged over 30 dollars for 1 entree and a very small single sized appetizer. I went home and saw my food was soggy and looked very old like it had been sitting out for a while. I was pissed. I should've gone to red lobster at least you know what your getting for the price. I'd give this place a negative star if I could. And I love Peruvian food!!!!

bk1U_NLfiCAGHQHGM14tNQ.text: To give this review some context: I lived in Miami for two years before moving to Phoenix fairly recently, and was absolutely spoiled with great Peruvian/Venezuelan/Cuban/Latin Fusion food as a result. My dining partner returned from a trip to Peru about 6 months ago. We have both been craving authentic Peruvian, and we were both absolutely delighted by El Chullo.  We began with the Pisco sours, which exceeded our sky-high expectations. Perfectly balancing sweet and sour, with a nice kick, these were the highlight of the meal. For the mains, my aunt had the lomo saltado, tender beef with onions, tomatoes, and tasty fries. I had my go-to, Aji de Gallina, which is a creamy chicken dish made with turmeric and yellow peppers, served with rice and potatoes. Both were well-prepared and delicious, as well as large enough to take home. The only item that I wouldn't recommend as highly was the yucca starter - the sauces were good, but the large sticks of yucca were too starchy for either of us. Everything else was fantastic - and it should be noted that El Chullo has both a happy hour and daily specials, so you can try a number of different menu items. Next time, I'll have to try dessert as well!  Just a couple of logistical notes: space is limited in the front of the restaurant, so you might need to find parking nearby. El Chullo is also quite small, so I would recommend either a reservation or an early visit (my aunt and I went around 4 pm). Overall, this restaurant is a must-try for anyone who enjoys Latin food and Latin fusion - enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lomo saltado in the front; yucca appetizer in the background
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pisco sours!!!
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aji de Gallina - my favorite!

7nWKuIzNiExm7z9kcs1CfQ.text: Stopped in on our way to Sedona from Vegas. This is definitely off the beaten path for sure and youd never find it on your own but Yelp and Google maps to the rescue.  Its a very small restaurant kind of in a residential area with linited space.  Prices are great and the food tasty. My Peruvian wife approved. She ordered the Lomo Saltado and I had the Bisteck.  You are given an option of sides. I chose rice and Peruvian beans. They also give you a cup of soup to start as well.  Given its in the middle of nowhere we thought it was a great find to satisfy our craving for Peruvian food.  Owners were very nice. Hopefully they can expand to a more visible place but was worth the effort and recommend ot.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lomo Saltado
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bisteck

A74jhkGLPZlIwNRa5hLJpQ.text: We tries this place based on the recommendation of one of our friends that is from Peru. We called early and got a reservation and I'm glad we did, the place was packed! We order the tequenos as I'm Venezuelan and I love tequenos, these are not what I expected, but the dish was True to its description. The pisco was great and the rest of the food was good. We tried almost all the desserts and by far the ice cream was a winner, not very sweet, creamy and flavorful. The place was full and loud, but the service was good.  Overall I liked the place and I will go back again and try the ceviche.

dEilVL_IZT8E5MzY28TCgA.text: Small family owned space, great service. You can tell from the moment you walk in they definitely have a crowd of regulars that come here to eat. Authentic Peruvian food, and the staff seems to be well versed in Peruvian culture/food as well.   Because it is a small space we made reservations before coming in. I asked our waitress what she recommend I ordered and I ended up with a delicious seafood and rice meal. I was impressed with the amount of seafood and the variety. I also shared an appetizer that was deep fried potato stuffed with ground beef, hard boiled egg & raisins. Tasted like a yummy tater tot!   My only complaint is that the restaurant was a bit warm, almost like the air conditioner wasn't working well.   Happy to have dined here! It's always nice to experience another culture and their food.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HAZAROOH1xdo2xJ2yOyBAQ.text: First time having Peruvian food and exceeded my already high expectations! We started with Papa Reyena which was amazing and flavorful! I got the Arroz con Pollo and both were filled with flavor! He got the Arroz con Mariscos and he thought it was great! Definitely recommend the Arroz con pollo!!!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papa Reyena
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz con Pollo y Arroz con Mariscos

l4iA0UYFuUfz6c6Obz77Ig.text: Chullo: A knit hat with earflaps  Papi Chullo: A Mac Daddy that wears a funny little hat with earflaps. Will treat you to El Chullo for some lomo saltado and ceviche mixto. Swears by the potent benefits of leche de tigre.  This place was packed on Friday night! We were lucky and managed to grab the last table available. When it gets this busy it is very noisy from all the diners talking with each other so if you like a more chill and quiet dining experience come here on a less busy time.   All the menu items looked so appealing and most of the customers here were conversing with the servers and themselves in Spanish which seemed like a good sign that this place serves legit Peruvian food.  We started with the causa rellena de pollo. It was a beautiful presentation, a layered cold dish of potato, avocado, chicken salad, and hard boiled egg. To be honest I didn't care for it too much as it skewed too sour tasting for me but my husband really liked it so YMMV.  For the main course I had the escabeche de pollo. You have your choice of white or dark meat, I opted for white. When it came out it looked impressive! This was one massive mutant chicken breast! Perhaps it was previously on a Real Chickens of Maricopa County show in an episode where Clucky goes to Scottsdale for a little "enhancement". Anyways, it was smothered in this gorgeous red, absolutely delicious sauce, with 2 chunks of perfectly cooked sweet potato and a pyramid of long grain rice. That sauce really was amazing. I loved the blend of spices with its piquant flavor. It looked and smelled so good that the guy at the table next to me asked what it was because he had never seen it before and wanted some too! The chicken was tender and well seasoned.  I had a bite of the lomo saltado too which had tender beef pieces, nicely crisp fries smothered in a delicious beef gravy.  Service was very sweet but a bit slow since it was so busy. I also felt slightly irked when one of the servers started questioning my dietary preferences. Hey if I don't want to order something because there's an ingredient I can't have just let it be! Our meals also took some time to get served to us due to the rush of customers.   Parking is a bit tight in the front, but there might be a lot in the back too.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Causa rellena de pollo
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Escabeche de pollo
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lomo saltado

_NDBvgQ-phsZOojojH5cVA.text: Was driving past and caught my eye, I thought to myself "yea some ceviche sounds good." Ordered the ceviche pescado off of their "specialties" section. The waiter asked if I wanted it hot, boy was I in for a surprise. "Hot" is not for the faint of heart, or anyone with acid reflux. Cleared my sinuses out immediately and about halfway through I had cleared the napkins from place settings within a 2 table radius. That being said the fish was fresh, the flavor was vibrant and while the peppers were hot, they were not obnoxious or distract from the sauces and seasonings.   Bottom line: if you are looking for something new that is light and refreshing, would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Civeche Pescado (sorry ruined the great presentation) but it was beautiful

ImZcL01_UFV7lWSDdV5THA.text: Pros:   * Extremely friendly staff. * Nice interior to the restaurant. * Free little bowl of "fancy corn nuts" * Great happy hour with $3 beers and six $5 "smaller" apps to try.  Cons:  * TV kind of ruins the vibe. * Food tasted a little bland to me.  But of course I'm not a Peruvian food expert.  Overall, I'd come back.    Here's the tip:  The seafood looked bout 2x as good as the chicken and meat, but not much more expensive.  Bonus tip:  If you don't like potatoes, you're probably going to struggle with this food.  Potatoes were central to every dish we tried.  My wife and I had plenty of food and some beers for $40.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aji de gallina $12.95
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Top 6 apps except the 2nd are each $5 during happy hour!   Along with $3 beer bottles and $6 wine glasses.
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Table in main dining area.

W5T2sC0fG8el3-lEQbmitQ.text: Best Peruvian in Arizona hands down! Kind of a smaller place right off Thomas and has very limited parking in front of the restaurant. There's available parking in the back which is a little easier to get in and out if the restaurant.  First time going here, I had to go with the classic Pollo Saltado and it was delicious! I lived in Los Angeles for quite some years and El Chullo has one of the best Saltados I've eaten. The fries were still crispy, the sauce was delicious and the chicken was cooked just right. One thing I wish they had was Aji sauce but outside that, this place is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lomo saltado. Absolutely the best!

8TakE_VThjJcvbzAhh4QBQ.text: We came for dinner during the week, it wasn't too busy so the five of us got seated right away. I absolutely love Peruvian food so I was really excited to try this place out.   We ordered the Lomo Saltado and the Aji De Gallina. Both items were really good. The steak for the Lomo Saltado was very tender and just perfect. The sauce for the Aji De Gallina was a bit filling but it was good.   The service was really good, it's hard finding a good Peruvian restaurant so we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aji De Gallina
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lomo Saltado

nLo9hlKHDMEE9yhsMhJ_7w.text: Our second time here in two years (we live in Indiana).  We LOVE this place!  The papas rellenos are fantastic as an appetizer.  They're big, and one is enough for two to three to taste.    This time I got a sampler three appetizer platter for my main course.  Fried pork with plantains, fried yucca, and beef hearts with potatoes.  All were good, the last my favorite.  The heart and potato dish has an amazing sauce.  Fast and friendly service, large portions.  Wonderful food.  If you've never had Peruvian food, you have to try this place. If you HAVE tried Peruvian food, this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three dish appetizer sampler.  From top:   Beef hearts and potatoes; fried yucca with two sauces; fried pork and plantains.  Wonderful!

X_cHRRtl1AhYaQXOc5nCkg.text: The best peruvian food Ive had in a long time. Great atmosphere and staff. Just like a home cooked meal. Small place always busy. Be prepared to wait but they will make you feel at home I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d6lEE4Ay52n6t6X53Oz3pg.text: I was really looking forward in trying this restaurant. I went on a weekend afternoon, greeted in Spanish which is great since I'm going to visit Peru soon however I don't know that much.  Friendly staff however not very helpful when looking at the menu. Especially with a customer who doesn't speak Spanish. No ice in the soda nor did the waiter ever come by to give a refill. The sweet potato chips were soggy and the Aji de Gallina was pretty bland, needed salt and lacked flavor and spice.  Cute place but the customer service to non Spanish speakers and the preparation of meals needs attention.

pL084Xz0JdCRgOJLuFOrLQ.text: Skip this place!!!  The food was awful & so disappointing the sauces are usually delicious in CA!  But there's was not even edible! The service was lousy they brought the wrong food despite I kept telling her and explaining it perfectly then 30 minutes later after asking 4 times for the manager he finally figured it out and the girl never even apologized! Their bathroom was extremely small &  very dirty it was disgusting! And a friend told me another time they called to place an order and again the waitress couldn't understand what she kept saying and what she was trying to order & despite spelling it the dumb, rude waitress hung up on my friend!  This place is disgusting and so is the service!

6xSTpzM-53T8wKEXqOg-2g.text: I had the Papa A La Huancaina which is boiled sliced potatoes covered by a spicy cheese which has Aji Amarillo (yellow pepper). I thought the potatoes and cheese were great but the Aji Amarillo in the sauce is definitely an acquired taste.  Ordered the Passionfruit juice which was delicious. Also, ordered the Tallarin Saltado Con Carne which was tenderloin lean strips with sauteed red onions, tomatoes, green onions, and spaghetti. Since it was not dry, but stew like with sauteed items, my best description of it is a fajita stew. Highly recommend.  The one drink, plus an appetizer, plus an entree, came out to $30.  Also, the place is small, so not the best for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tallarin Saltado Con Carne
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Papa A La Huancaina
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Peruvian Festival is on July 28, 2018

QJVxWv66_aSW1X6wP6h4pg.text: We have been eyeing this place for several years, never finding the opportunity to stop in and try it out. Finally, today, we were able to make the time for lunch at El Chullo, and we were not disappointed.   The restaurant is small, maybe 8 tables and the bar area, but don't let that dissuade you from having a seat and noshing on some crunchy, salted Inca corn whilst you peruse the menu. The service is prompt and so warm and friendly, and we were seated and brought waters and the aforementioned snack immediately.  We started with the Papa Rellena, a large, egg-shaped doughy mashed potato ball, deep fried and filled with ground meat, eggs, olives, and raisins. Sounds like a wild combo, but it was amazing! It was rich and savory, with the occasional pop of sweetness from the raisins. The papa was served with the most OUTSTANDING lime-pickled red onion slices with cilantro. The punchy tang of the onions balanced out the richness of the papa rellena perfectly, and I found myself snacking on the slivers of goodness long after we had finished the potato cake.  For our entrees, hubby chose the Aji de Gallina, a super-rich dish of shredded chicken and potatoes in a creamy aji pepper sauce, served with steamed white rice. I had the Arroz con Pollo, arroz verde with a large chicken wing, corn, carrots, peas, and several soft chunks of potato(the latter smothered in the creamy aji sauce). Both of our dishes were exactly what we'd wanted, and mine was enhanced by those delectable pickled onions and a generous serving of a salty, tangy, spicy hot salsa the server provided me with.  Overall, this place is a gem. Absolutely wonderful, and we will be back again!

9p49nB5CQcZV_wWS1xSPhg.text: This is such a small little place but don't let that fool you. This place has some amazing food with amazing flavors. I have heard some great things about this place so I decided to give it a try. I started with the beef heart, I know what your all thinking but don't knock it tell you try it. It has such a great flavor and is tender even my kids all tried it when I brought home the leftovers and they all said it was good. I also ordered the AJI DE GALLINA which is shredded chicken in a cream sauce with aji amarillo. It was really good also and came with rice. Everyone needs to come try this place out you won't be disappointed.

efvE_GJBrK91EdCEfa7zyw.text: What a fun unique and quaint place.  We stopped in here after a game as we have always wanted to try it out. Has to be some of the best Peruvian food in the valley.  First of all the beer list is top notch. Yeah, they have some domestics, but I was highly impressed to see Kronenbourg 1664 on the list (at a $5 pop price) was super refreshing.  We started with the beef heart... tasted as good as it smelled and I mean this was marinated to a T. What was funny is one of the cooks when she placed it in front of us says "so me and my brother have decided because that one turned out perfect that we are going to make one for ourselves now" :). You know a place is tasty when the cooks turn around and eat what they are preparing... love that!  Side note... our kids are starting to branch out their pallets with us and when we came home we simply cut them each a bite (didn't tell them what it was) and they both fell in love. We mentioned afterward what it was and that didn't matter because they knew how delicious it was.  Another side note... if you have a dog with a pallet like ours, they go absolutely apeshit. Not that I know what giving someone crack is like, but the little dude was acting like he was on crack after the few nibbles we gave him. Wish we had a video.  Our next course was the aji de gallina. DEVINE and will leave it at that.  Couldn't have enjoyed this place more, from the food to the service to the beer selection at a reasonable price point.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bZuklHDn_1su8e2D1swOpg.text: This place would be a 4 star should the prices be about 30% less and better service. 14 dollars for a pisco sour does not justify the ambiance or amenities of the place. I've been there twice. The food is good but not great.

aQpg6FDr_1FwXPAgvvPzjA.text: This is my number one place to eat dinner whenever I go down to PHX from Flagstaff.  This place is a gem, always great service and amazing food.  The place is small, so calling in for a reservation is the way to go.  I have tried several dishes in the menu and have never been disappointed.  The Ceviche is one of the best I've had and the Jalea de Mariscos is to die for!!  Keep it up.  Can't wait till I'm down in PHX again!!

8c556EmlSH7Via0pBAjqdg.text: Best most authentic Peruvian food in town! Ceviche is off the chain! Food does take a while but totally worth it!

5jaeaDOlW0kAVcz83Ph2WA.text: I ate a vegetarian dish that was something like a pasta pesto. I immediately felt sick. I'm currently home with food poisoning. Something about my food was not right and even though the place is small, the service took forever. The ceviche was great but that's all the positivity I can muster.

SoF7qlkOh80Z9xblx6MDfw.text: This place is ridiculously good...so good I can't wait to go back there again.  The parking is very limited, so be prepared to park in the neighborhood and walk.  Trust me, you'll forget all about the parking situation once you try their food.    We shared a causa rellena to start and it was surprisingly fresh and flavorful.  For my entree, I selected the lomo saltado based on our server's recommendation and man, was he right - this dish is over the top good!  If you have not yet tried El Chullo, get in there and give it a try...don't let the exterior of the restaurant discourage you from trying this gem of a restaurant!

JnfSDSpY-cVJuUUzGUipIw.text: This place is amazing! I have been to Peru and I can say this place took me right back. Not just because of the incredible food (the mixed ceviche was just delicious!) but also because of the sincere kindness of the staff. Our waiter gave us his suggestions and was extremely accommodating and attentive! Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious and I can say with confidence that I will definitely be back. Thanks, El Chullo!

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mixed ceviche...
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Escabeche de Pollo!! Beautiful and delicious!
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arroz con Pollo! (With the white meat)

SOr4Wve1YJ81fvc6uoGSsw.text: I have never Peruvian food in the United States that tasted as if you were in Lima, Peru. The gastronomy of this country is amazing, I always enjoy the food whenever I have visited the country. This restaurant was amazing. My sister and I went out to eat and I found it on Yelp. My food was excellent! Everything was delicious!

Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5Zb5q9dCKIKBkSBsHK51Mg.text: BEST PLACE EVER!! Where do I start? Service was quick and hospitable. Our server, the owners son, was such a friendly guy and very helpful. My husband got the Tallarines with Seafood. Creamy pasta with tons of seafood! Totally worth the price. I was recomended the Escabeche de Pollo. Oh boy! Finger licking sauce and perfetly balanced dish. This place is legit and authentic. They take pride in their food and you can taste the love. The chicha was delightful. We were here on our anniversary and the experience was much more than I anticipated. Please come and fall in love with Peruvian food.

WhDf9QyCsSjiUsvN2A_zrQ.text: Peruvian cuisine is Interesting,  flavorful and varied. El Chullo is a very small restaurant so recommend making reservations. Thee stars only as I thought the staff was not the friendliest and the Sangria was mostly fruit juice and very little wine. The parking lot in front of restaurant is very small with very few spots so be ready to park in the neighborhood.   Ordered the Lomo Saltado, which essentially is slivers of beef with French fries. and while I thought was good, could have had more meat considering the price of $ 14.95 . El Chullo is not an inexpensive restaurant. A word of caution, the restaurant closes early on Sundays at 7 P.M so get there early.

4eYInkd9Uh5FnzQ9-eUEAQ.text: I'm the beginning service was great . I go to Peruvian places in California and this place was very much different. With that being I said I ordered my favorite shrimp chowder soup it taste nothing like the Peruvian food back home . My dad makes better shrimp chowder . They put peas and carrots . Gross. The menu says veggies , yes I probably should have asked what veggies but I didn't . I hate peas and I told the waiter if I could get something new I don't like peas . She argued with me and said it says on the menu it has peas then says well no it doesn't it says veggies . After I conversation she come back and says they will make you a new one with no peas. I didn't want a new one I just wanted something else but guess she ignored that . Any other professional restraunt satisfies the customer apologizes and takes the dish off the check and asks if there is anything they can do to compliment the customer . Anyways, I took my left overs for lunch today guess what I found a pea . They didn't make me a new bowl they sat there and took the peas out . I am very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

acBUmgqOwNJe2jWt1W-yBA.text: This place was great. My family and I enjoyed the delicious Peruvian food they offered. The only complaint I have is that the place is too Small and the deserts are a bit pricey.

y2kxqnUdkQU8FyJmh_xGuA.text: What! I don't know how I've been missing this place. The traditional Pisco sour was amazing, like an alcoholic, less sweet, key lime pie. I had chicharrones, a stuffed potato pastry that was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Both were served with lime juice and cilantro marinated red onions that gave the dishes such perfect balance. A pork stew for my entree and I was stuffed to the gills and exceedingly pleased. The staff is crazy friendly. Will go back four to five million more times.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yeah. I dug in so fast I didn&#39;t even take a picture until it was mostly demolished.

Z3tcEtTmGp_c9ewWY9sTFQ.text: This place is definitely legit. Came here for our Early Valentines Dinner on Friday night. The owner and Chef and family are cool and nice. Chef Omar brings out your food to your table. I had a beef pasta (forget the actual peruvian name for it) but it was super tasty and so good. Also, the ceviche is just so much fun to eat and look at. Very tasty and colorful and flavorful. Only downside, my BF made reservations and when we got there one of the sisters at the front foor said we couldn't be seated because they had a big party at 8pm. However we had reservations...in which she had written our name down and finally we got sat.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peruvian Beef Pasta Dish
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peruvian Ceviche

poChdRL5TxOuZwEzaCO1kA.text: Finally! This Peruvian joint is legit!  We moved from the Bay Area in California a little under a year ago and have been searching for good and authentic Peruvian food and we're sooo very happy we found it here at El Chullo!  Let me add, that in the Bay Area you have the gammit of delicious food options and even there a good Peruvian place was hard to find.  So we were super surprised that El Chullo met and exceeded our expectations.  1. The ceviche was fabulous! Good amount of acidity, well prepared seafood, and it had all the fixings (corn, sweet potato, onion, etc.) 2. We split an appetizer plate of 3 fixings and all of them were delicious!  The portions were proper size, and the prices were appropriate for the quality of food that was served!   We will defninitely be back again.   Lastly, we drove 30 minutes to get here and it was worth it!

tS6ddU9IJVpxGHM4QYNagg.text: I'm pretty sure I won't be able to say enough good things about this restaurant. Jeez - everything from the delectable adult beverages, through the amazing appetizers, to the main courses - wow!!! Over the top delicious. It's another one of those places I don't want to get too crowded, but I don't want it to go away. Stay busy, but not too busy, you know? Head over there - you won't regret the Papa Rellena for starters, the Arroz con Pollo with its perfectly seasoned chicken and yellow rice (enough for 2, btw), or the Carapulcra - a heavenly potato stew with yucca that I still can't get out of my mind. Enjoy. I know you will.

vJS-gl3lXKobh6ggNEC0dA.text: Great food and service...   Had Lunch on Valentines Day ....   MUST HAVE --- Pisco Sour drink which is made with  -fresh lime juice, cinnamon & cloves syrup, beaten egg whites, angostura bitter.  ARROZ CON MARISCOS Sauteed rice & seafood mix.  Only issue is parking very limited space .....

noXk-Jas1cweBvLTQl0TlQ.text: Food is just ok nothing really special so I am so surprised by all the great reviews. Restaurant is small and they don't have proper ventilation so you leave smelling like fried food. Won't be coming back.

CTAnxNK7W7DtkX1K-VNf3w.text: Peruvian cuisine seems to be based on chicken and potatoes- fine with me. El Chullo is a New Times Award winning place on 7th Street north of Virginia. Can't remember the names of what I ordered but the appetizer was a thin sliced marinated fried potato. You eat them like potato chips but they are not dry and slightly crispy. The entree was a chicken breast, pan fried in a red pepper vinegar sauce with red onion slices. Very good! There was a small side of potatoes and a rather large pyramid of white rice. I love rice but I prefer it flavored. I almost asked for more red pepper vinegar sauce for the rice. It was similar to Japanese sticky rice. The place was small, clean, nice artwork on the walls, flat screen tv with Fox Spanish channel showing a soccer game. They have a full bar so we ordered a carafe of Sangria- iced, filled with what appeared to be fruit cocktail- very good and pared well with the meal. We ate the wine soaked fruit like a dessert. El Chullo has an air of authenticity about it and I most likely will go back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliced marinated fried potatoes and fried dry corn that had a popcorn flavor
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Those are slices of sweet potatoes behind the white rice pyramid

8624a6xNdF4TZNmajCldGQ.text: Omg... hands down the best Peruvian restaurant in Arizona!!! Yum... and I know, my wife is Peruvian ;)

fmrVpaeO6ggx0Iy8mkesug.text: Divine Peruvian food. I had the PAPA RELLENA & the chicken escabeche which both were amazing. I also drank the pisco drink w ginger ale which I like better than pisco sours. I'm going back here ALOT, I'm Peruvian and this is authentic food w fantastic flavor. Can't wait to try their ceviche and seco next time I go.....

3KpeY201S4EI6dbMX-uRXA.text: So good! Felt like I was back in Peru for a moment! Their Rocoto salsa was AMAZING!! The food was fantastic. Family owned and operated, and they were all super nice. Step out of your comfort zone and grab some authentic Peruvian flavors at this place!

55V3KN4MyCV4RPe89FFkSg.text: Need fancy intimate decor and ambiance?  Not here... instead you'll get polite service and pretty darn good food.  Don't let the interior (or exterior) discourage you.  Having absolutely no experience with Peruvian cuisine I had not idea what the carapulcra would be.  It was definitely a different take on 'stew', but it was delicious and they even stack your rice into the shapes of temples.  4/5 service 2/5 decor 5/5 food 5/5 location  (pictures coming)

xfuGmSgnYfy6iKya2ALRuA.text: Been meaning to write post for months. Dated a Peruvian for over 5 years and been in Peru many times. This place is not your run of the mill Peruvian spot. Authentic food with a gourmet touch. Look forward to returning

Iq7k6SgZYw83WMOlSd9NDA.text: We were excited to find a Peruvian restaurant with vegetarian options, so decided to try it. I was pleasantly surprised to learn that it is family run. They were extremely warm and hospitable and the food was freshly prepared home style! Even the piscos were thoughtfully made :) We enjoyed our evening and would definitely go back.

huRWaOo4bgK7LjuMChCk_A.text: Came here for the pisco sours after watching an episode of booze traveler. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the drink is, very sweet! I ordered the cilantro chicken soup, it was delicious. The soup tasted just like homemade chicken soup with a cool green color! Would definitely recommend for date night or small (2-4) groups!

258X_ObNMOxMJKn4Dl3s7Q.text: Food was decent. Good cerviche. Fried fish was a bit heavy. Place didn't run their a/c. Checked their thermostat next to the bathroom and it was 91 degrees in the place. Towards the end of the meal it was difficult to even be in there anymore. It's 105 outside today, there is no excuse for not running the a/c. Won't be coming back.

1L63L9KFux9DXaag2f2ytw.text: Pretty much everything here is good. Tacu tacu seafood is delightful. My favorite though is the lomo saltado.

kcf06pWRwsK9ayHT7ly6pg.text: Great, great little restaurant. Having traveled Latin America for a while I was excited to try some Peruvian food. And it was great. The beef cuts I had were one of the best marinated pieces of meat I have had. And for desert I had this Argentinean cookie called alfajore... It was great. I love small places like this that do good right and are simple. Will go back for sure.

ImByZunhkprKW0OwuZP-0Q.text: The service was great, and fast.  Everything we had- ceviche, anticuchos, lomo saltado, and causa rellena, were all excellent.  Just wish they had some kind of happy hour.  Will definitely be back.

CEulPC1F2fAbhKPaA4gvrg.text: The restaurant is small, but clean, Good food, and exceptional service. I definitely recommend it.

6IEkZ6m3Fhol54wVgQLXtQ.text: Great food and biggest glass of wine EVER.  Very nice people.  And the lunch special is enough for two!

-d03kVH7tN2zJ3oOT4L3hQ.text: Worst service ever!! Now I know what it feels like to be discriminated against! If you're Peruvian, you good to go. Otherwise, do not enter! We were sat at a tiny little table in the middle of the restaurant that was smokey. We waited 10 minutes and never even offered glass of water!

C_tU4YGmECRmTNs3zj1FDQ.text: This is a small family run business. Everyone in the kitchen is related. The service was excellent, the atmosphere is great and the food was spectacular. Best Peruvian food we've had in AZ!! We sat at the bar and I enjoyed a great Argentinian red wine while my husband drank a Spanish lager. Both were delicious. After our meal the Owner stopped over to ask how it was. We talked for a long time and his wife came out from the kitchen to say hello as well. Super super sweet couple. We will definitely be back. This will be on the list of places we take visitors and I will be bringing customers from work as well.

V5Y5iMEo-_u1YMP3B85FYA.text: My friend and I came there last night and the small restaurant was packed. Who I believe was one of the owners/main chef greeted us and explained it might be a while before we could order because they were so busy. She was so warm and kind and so was everyone else. My friend and I had a pisco maracuya (passion fruit pisco) and they were delicious. We also split a causa rellena, a cold mashed potato cake with a chicken filling, and the lomo saltado, a dish with beef tenderloin and french fries and rice.  Everything was really delicious and seasoned so well but next time I will probably opt for less starch in one meal.  I rated this five stars because I really couldn't get over how wonderful the overall experience was to talk with the Peruvian chef and feel somewhat like I was with family :). Also, this woman recommended the ceviche because it's prepared unique to Peruvian culture and I will say it looked amazing at someone else's table.

3JbNh7sRW4R7sIcv9Irjdw.text: Well I was just visiting Phoenix and needed a lunch spot fast. Stumbled across this place and could not have been happier with the food and service. This is not fine dining, it is a neighborhood place with as close to homemade latin food as you can get. I started with some yucca frittas which were great and came with two very tasty salsas. I had a chicken dish (forgot the name) with a red sauce that was slightly greasy but packed with flavor and delicious. My friend had the arroz con pollo which was also excellent. Crap even the iced tea was apparently homemade. The server was attentive and made us feel at home. The place doesn't look like much but it is a great place for well prepared Peruvian food at good prices. I will definitely go here again when I'm in town.

AulWajn-DuN12eMZlcCtYg.text: Don't let the small store front fool you; this place makes up for it once you are inside. Delicious food, very authentic. Glad to have found this. This is the place to come to really have a taste of Peru. They have cultural tv as well. The workers are very nice people.

ZjRlONn-p8gQBF2sCChUpA.text: I love El Chullo! I grew up in Peru and I've had a hard time finding good Peruvian food in Phoenix but boy, El Chullo gets it just right! I would go more often if it weren't that pricey. I mean, considering it's a "hole-in-the-wall" type of restaurant, I think their dishes are a little overpriced. But it's delicious for sure!

kinLBfLQ-wvnZMZLxJdDEA.text: Consistantly very good.  My wife is peruvian and I am very familiar with peruvian food.  The food is better than many restaurants in peru.  I love the anticuchos, and causas.  The lomo saltado is great, aji de gallina also.  Escaveche de pollo was brilliant, but was a little too over spiced.  Also loved the Lucuma ice cream. Solid 4.5  stars.

bH9V9mHTWjzEPurTCprI4g.text: The reason I rated it ok was due to the service.  The food was excellent.  It is a small restaurant and we went on a Friday evening (myself and another person) We were told we would have to sit at the bar because the tables for 4 people were being held for people of 3 or more. the bar is right at the front door so I didn't feel comfortable sitting there. I spotted an empty table for two near the window and asked if we could sit there. We would told yes (why she didn't ask us if we wanted that table in the beginning, I don't know). We were given menus and ordered our food with just water for beverage. It does take a while for the food to come but the portions are good and the food was delicious. I had the ESCABECHE DE POLLO (chicken garnished with sauteed red onion, aji amarillo, aji panca, & vinegar), my partner had the ARROZ CON POLLO (Cilantro based green rice with veggies, & chicken). The waitress never came back to refill our water or check on us. Customer service is big with me and even though the food was excellent, I'd have to rethink going back.

EsL7WpdwbVE7P9Lh0j4DpQ.text: AMAZIING Peruvian food!! They make an awesome pisco sour and the ceviche was incredible! You have to get the lomo saltado!

-BG8JjvfxUrog2FrmkYYeA.text: 5 WELL-DESERVED STARS!!!! El Chullo is a small and unassuming hidden gem so we ended up passing it and having to turn around, but it was so worth it! Honestly, we had reservations and a Living Social deal at another Peruvian restaurant but ditched that place to come here because of the great Yelp reviews and SO GLAD WE DID! This place has both the best Peruvian food and the friendliest service of any Peruvian restaurant there has been in the valley for at least the last 20 years. We've tried them all (including some out of state) and by far this place has the best alfajores we've ever had- luscious creamy dulce de leche sandwiched between delicate creamy colored disks of flaky, buttery, goodness- oh my!  I'm still dreaming about them. The lucuma ice cream and chicha morada are also must tries. The chicha morada was refreshingly smooth and light- almost like a fine wine. We also had the appetizer sampler, the tamal, the aji de gallina, the jalea mixta, and the bistek and tallarines verdes. Next time we'll order the papa rellena and/or the yucca on their own (the sampler sizes were pretty small) and skip the tamal. The warm welcoming friendliness of the family/staff made our experience such an exceptional one that we ended up ordering a lot more than we planned and enjoying ourselves immensely. We love supporting family-owned businesses and Esperanza and Chef Omar and his cute sisters are so nice they make you want to come back again and again- well for them and the Alfajores :). I only wish it wasn't 30 mins. away, but so good it's worth the drive.

IlA-FWlXbITq4ScmURNtgQ.text: Finally, a Peruvian restaurant we can actually go to in Phoenix!  The food was absolutely delicious.  The ceviche is outstanding and we'll be ordering that every time.  Everything we ordered was delicious and even my 1 year old enjoyed the food and she's a picky eater.  Our waitress was Maria and she was great and gave great recommendations.  We're definitely coming back.

avZ7iEOv7bo0uTmN9QgRdQ.text: One of my fave date night spots. Feels very homey and food is authentic and so tasty you can almost forgive the super long wait times for food during peak hours. Ceviche, Aji de Gallina, and lomo saltado are my faves, but everything I've tried has been great.   Parking can be a bit of an issue - they have a small lot in the back which can fill up (DON'T park in the adjacent parking lot just past the restaurant). Definitely worth all the trouble, though!

JeSP3lFkP_zVODH8hGNGdQ.text: The alfajores rock! My one single favorite thing from this place. Peruvian food is not my favorite, cannot comment on the food.

Nqq9t7B6cEoG_soUIuERww.text: Dear El Chullo, you have just earned a huge piece of my eating out budget. Wow. From a Cuban girl, who is super picky about her Hispanic foods... the Shrimp Chupe... the best I've ever had....the Lomo salteado, what a wonderful guilty pleasure and yucca fries! I'm in food heaven. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Chupe
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fxXz2lCTKQlcK9RToEEBXg.text: We were in Phoenix and couldn't figure out where to go for food.  I typed in my favorite Latin dish, arroz con pollo and came across this place! Glad I found it! My fiance and I were pleasantly surprised with how good this small place is.  Every table was full on a Saturday night.  We weren't used to seeing this in Phoenix.  The arroz con pollo was so good! We also ordered ceviche which was bomb.   The texture of the fish was perfect.  I also tried a pisco sour which was excellent.

OG9oojaAlvtfm7ODdH4pIA.text: The food was great and the atmosphere was nice. The waitress was very helpful. Prices are exactly what you should pay. Very easy to get there and find the restaurant. I look forward to going back.

vlIuwGjjHdFkijjt7NBrzA.text: Decided to to try something different, new. Picked this place out of the blue.  I am super glad I did. Everything I tried was a little different but delicious.  Definitely coming back. A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Milanesa (breaded chicken)
Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo Saltado (chicken)

9MkV2gtFHAbQbo9zI47zJQ.text: This is a great place for authentic Peruvian food. Super delicious! Pretty small, crowded restaurant though with sometimes long wait times and no seating while you wait. Also a little pricey.

cNMqzMALDBtgecxEcs1ePA.text: Drove 45 ... Well worth it .. The Ceviche Mixto is to die for. Everything was great, from the presentation, portion, texture, flavor and spices .. Just Perfect ! Super Friendly staff, easy to talk to and very knowledgeable about their dishes, def coming back next time I'm in AZ !

photos.caption: Photo of El Chullo Peruvian Restaurant & Bar - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceviche Mixto

muTM7ofau9ZS_UO8Uio1Eg.text: The next best thing to actually being in Peru.   The beverages were great - the Pisco Sour and Chicha Morada deserve 5 stars by themselves. The entrees were also a hit. I ordered the Aji de Gallina, and my boyfriend ordered the Ceviche. He was so blown away by the Ceviche that he wants to go back for it every weekend. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the appetizer. We ordered Yuca Frita, and it was a little over-fried for my taste.   Overall, it was a great dining experience. I am from Peru and felt like I was eating from my family's kitchen. I will mention that it ended up being a bit pricey, BUT it was worth it.

CCHDn6ShcWRe15Tr5BkNbg.text: Food is amazing!!! I had the lomo saltado and it was the thing of dreams. The chicken ajio was a weird texture but good overall. The service was slow but the food more than made up for it.

x7g8k6J3SO5XtZDbksoumg.text: I love the lomo saltado. Meat was very tender and the sauce was on point. Service was great. The place is a little small and the place tends to get busy.(That's what she said). If you're on the fence about trying out this nice little quaint restaurant, jump off the fence and walk on in. You will not be disappointed.

y72ER6lN0dnwRfKH_TvD_g.text: Wow ... delicious food, and fine service ... they get crazy busy though (we ate lunch at 2:45 p.m., and even at that hour there only a couple of empty tables) ... unless they expand, you will have to take your chances on getting a seat, or be very patient.

IKTAmSgNtaZQslC0CyaIzw.text: I'm a Peruvian girl and I always think my mom's Peruvian home cooked meals are actually the best. I came to El Chullo on Peruvian Independence Day (July 28th) with my dad in order to celebrate. I ordered the lomo saltado and he ordered the cau cau. As much as I love my mom, I hate to say that this lomo saltado is just as good (maybe even a bit better - please don't tell her). I told my hubby that I have to take him here so that he can try it out for himself. I even loved their rocoto (hot peppered sauce) and I dipped my french fries in them. It was spicy...but a good spice.  I highly recommend this place if you want to try good Peruvian food!

RGQOgLjYMmn3Y1gtI7gOzw.text: The food was delicious!  We had the tacu tacu and a pork tamale as the appetizer. Everything was well seasoned and fulfilling. The only down side was the price. We went for lunch and paid dinner prices ($35 per person about, without a drink). The place is small,  too, so I can see seating being a problem.
